data.title: One for Scrappy, a rarity!!!
data.meta_description: Scrappy...... I'm after a record (45') that seems impossible to find, my older brother used to hang out with this local Adelaide band at the time (late 60's - e
data.text:
by firstblood Wed Jan 08, 2014 9:58 am

Scrappy......

I'm after a record (45') that seems impossible to find, my older brother used to hang out with this local Adelaide band at the time (late 60's - early 70's) who made only one single. the band was called the 'James Wright Group', and the song was 'Louise'. A great song that made the charts but that was it, got good coverage on radio, possibly 5KA or 5AD, which ever station was more popular for us rockin' 60's types at the time.

Didn't hear from them again, on record anyway.

There's Nothing on Youtube... i know they made an appearance on one of those tv music hit shows you watched on Saturday mornings, (channel 10? or 7? ) so there must be a recording some where.

Cheers.

Last edited by firstblood on Fri Apr 15, 2016 3:56 pm; edited 3 times in total

Re: One for Scrappy, a rarity!!!

by Scrappy Wed Jan 08, 2014 10:49 am

James Wright

Released 2 records

They might have been :

Louise/Good Times Together

Never Had A Girl /Half A Minute

by Scrappy Wed Jan 08, 2014 6:44 pm

Must confess I cant recall the James Wright Group

Have read up on them , they did have a drummer called John Swan

Swanee went on to forge a decent career

I have a treasured CD in my possession called :

BIG BEAT SCENE

It has 28 tracks of Adelaide bands between 1965-1970

There's a lot of unreleased tracks

It is a gem of a CD

The bands are ;

The Silouhettes

The Outcasts

The Reins

Five Sided Circle

Hugo

The Rythem

The Syssys

The London Criers

Wee Hike

Blues Rags N Hollers

Machine Gun Kellys Rejects

The Others

The Harts

Animation Unlimited

Autumn

The Force

The Blues Syndicate

The Bucket

Inside Looking Out

The Zoot

Nozmo King

Inkase

Travis Wellington Hedge

The only ones I knew about was The Zoot

They play a song called I Can Hear The Grass Grow

This is my favorite CD at the moment

Its expensive , and retails for close to $30 in some outlets around Adelaide

I'm after some more rare Adelaide vinyls and CDs from the 60s

Will post if I find any

Re: One for Scrappy, a rarity!!!

by blacky Wed Jan 08, 2014 8:29 pm

Scrappy thank you very much your are bringing back some memories

Re: One for Scrappy, a rarity!!!

by firstblood Wed Jan 08, 2014 9:38 pm

spinner wrote:

firstblood wrote:Scrappy......

I'm after a record (45') that seems impossible to find, my older brother used to hang out with this local Adelaide band at the time (late 60's - early 70's) who made only one single. the band was called the 'James Wright Group', and the song was 'Louise'. A great song that made the charts but that was it, got good coverage on radio, possibly 5KA or 5AD, which ever station was more popular for us rockin' 60's types at the time.

Didn't hear from them again, on record anyway.

There's Nothing on Youtube... i know they made an appearance on one of those tv music hit shows you watched on Saturday mornings, (channel 10? or 7? ) so there must be a recording some where.

Cheers.

I vaguely remember that song. I was a teenager at the time, around 13 -14 and it had a catchy chorus...

I might be wrong but i think it went a little bit like this......

We used to run together L _ o _ u _ i _ s _ e

We used to be happier than a ??? (something or an other)

That's where i can't remember anymore of the lines. But i remember the lead singer had a fairly deep voice and a good one too.

Is that the song F/B ?

God, that's a long time ago and a great era in music.

That's the song Spinner, my memory is as good as yours...we must be getting old.

I'l upload it to Youtube it once Scrappy has done his magical trick. We can't let classics from our youth disappear forever.

Re: One for Scrappy, a rarity!!!

by Scrappy Wed Jan 08, 2014 10:09 pm

Good to see some of you more senior baby boomers' reminiscing'

Re: One for Scrappy, a rarity!!!

by Scrappy Thu Jan 09, 2014 2:50 pm

Got a hold of some James Wright Trax

Heard Louise for the first time today[44 years later !]

A very good song

Lead singer has a rich voice

Bits + pieces of The Guess Who, Blood Sweat and Tears , and Douggie Parkinson in the voice

And just for some of you the opening line of the song

Louuuuuuuweeeeeeeeze

Like a picture on a photograph."

Last edited by Scrappy on Fri Jan 10, 2014 8:56 am; edited 3 times in total

Re: One for Scrappy, a rarity!!!

by IAmTheWarrior Thu Jan 09, 2014 3:00 pm

Wow- delivered in just over 24 hours- you are amazing Scrappy!! I'm impressed.

Re: One for Scrappy, a rarity!!!

by Scrappy Thu Jan 09, 2014 7:01 pm

Things fell into place within the 24 hours

Sometimes it can take forever or never to track down rarities

I don't deserve any credit

Its the contacts that I have that track down rarities

Early South Australian artists of the 60's are generally under-rated

I come across some of these bands who never made it big time, and some of their tracks are excellent

JAMES WRIGHT GROUP

Tracking down the James Wright Group ends up being fun for me

FIVE SIDED CIRCLE

Five Sided Circle do a sensational rendition of Cadillac

WEE HIKE

Wee Hike were a band that gigs around Adelaide in the 60's

I know of a couple of members of that band

They had a catchy rollocky song called Howadiddi

Re: One for Scrappy, a rarity!!!

by firstblood Fri Jan 10, 2014 12:28 pm

Well here it is, many thanks to Scrappy...

I didn't realize how great the lead singer's voice was...very deep and rich.

Blacky, go to the Video on youtube https://youtu.be/lom7Y122nNk and use http://www.video2mp3.net/ to rip the music to Mp3 and download.

Louise - went to no 2 on the charts 1970. Not bad for a local Adelaide band.

Re: One for Scrappy, a rarity!!!

by Scrappy Fri Jan 10, 2014 12:50 pm

For anyone looking for rare music

Let me know I can direct you to an appropriate contact

PM me

Re: One for Scrappy, a rarity!!!

by testy Sat Jan 11, 2014 1:06 pm

Well done scrappy, I thought I might have that track on an old compilation album (33rpm) but I don't have it unfortunately.

The James Wright Band initially formed as a trio called The Big Apple in Adelaide in 1967 and performed there first gig at the Octagon in Elizabeth. They became a regular at "Big Daddys Discotheque"--now there is a name from the past. They were also known for a short while as "James Riot"

Fast forward a year and they became a five piece band known as "James Wright Group"

They shared the billing at many places in Adelaide over a couple of years with The Valentines, The Twilights, Max Merritt and The Meteors, Billy Thorpe and The Aztecs, The Mixtures and also performed as a backing band for solo artists including Johnny Farnham, Ronnie Burns, Jeff Phillips, Liv Maessen and Johnny Young.

Funny thing was that no band member had the name "James Wright" so I don't know how they came up with this name.

Re: One for Scrappy, a rarity!!!

JAMES WRIGHT

Louise song

$15

Re: One for Scrappy, a rarity!!!

by firstblood Wed Apr 30, 2014 7:08 pm

Another one for Scrappy...

Back in the 60's, i had a 45 vinyl record that was lost over the years... i can't recall the name of the song or artist... That's a good start

It could have been called 'Seagull' or 'Seagulls'.. looked every where for it, there are songs on Youtube with the name Seagulls but not the song i want...

Anyway, this particular song was a protest type of song to do with the shooting of birds or animals...

In the chorus i remember a few words... 'There's a big man with a gun, and he's having lots of fun' and the sounds of boob boom (gun shots) Fairly quick lyrics.

I don't think it was a hit, but i remember having the record. It could be just one of many thousands of songs lost in space some where.

Tough one Scrappy... maybe an impossible one to find.

Re: One for Scrappy, a rarity!!!
